meta.name: keywords
meta.content: Jeopardy Archive Cameron Yahr Thad McCollum Matt Kish Final clue response question answer Daily Double

meta.name: description
meta.content: An archive of clues and players for Jeopardy! show #6795.

td.p: Cameron Yahr, a university administrator from Encinitas, California
Thad McCollum, a door person from Orlando, Florida
Matt Kish, a high school history teacher from Brunswick, Ohio (whose 1-day cash winnings total $23,201)

tr.td: CONTEMPORARIES
BILLIARDS SHOTS
CELEBS CELEBRATING
OH, "SNAP"
POTPOURRI
CLOSE QUARTERS

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_1_1', 'clue_J_1_1_stuck', 'In 1852 Dickens started publishing "Bleak House" & he was finishing the text of The "Ring" Cycle')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: In 1852 Dickens started publishing "Bleak House" & he was finishing the text of The "Ring" Cycle

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_2_1', 'clue_J_2_1_stuck', 'The shot that hits a full rack of balls to start a game')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: The shot that hits a full rack of balls to start a game

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_3_1', 'clue_J_3_1_stuck', 'On a Beverly Hills roof in 2011, he feted his firing from "Two And A Half Men" holding a machete & saying, "Free at last!"')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: On a Beverly Hills roof in 2011, he feted his firing from "Two And A Half Men" holding a machete & saying, "Free at last!"

div.onmouseover:
toggle('clue_J_4_1', 'clue_J_4_1_stuck', '(Matt: What is a camera?)
...
(Alex: [*], yes, "SNAP" in quotation marks.)

a snapshot

MattThad
')

div.onmouseout: toggle('clue_J_5_2', 'clue_J_5_2_stuck', '(Kelly of the Clue Crew shows a formula on the monitor.) The old rule was to multiply this pet\'s age by 7 to get its age in human years; today, there\'s an updated formula that depends on what kind of breed, but it often comes out to be about the same')

a.title: Suggest a correction for this clue

tr.td: (Kelly of the Clue Crew shows a formula on the monitor.) The old rule was to multiply this pet's age by 7 to get its age in human years; today, there's an updated formula that depends on what kind of breed, but it often comes out to be about the same

The Jeopardy! game show and all elements thereof, including but not limited to copyright and trademark thereto, are the property of Jeopardy Productions, Inc. and are protected under law.
